decision_conditions:
Reason : 1 - The proposed gable end in conjunction with the existing side element, by reason of its bulk and prominent siting, would result in discordant addition to the dwelling and would be out of keeping with the local pattern of development and give would appear contrived in design, to the detriment of  the character of the host dwelling and the local area, and would therefore fail to comply with high quality design aspirations of the National Planning Policy Framework (2019),  Policy D3 D (11) of the London Plan (2021), Core Policy CS1B of the Harrow Core Strategy (2012), policy DM1 of the Harrow Development Management Policies Local Plan (2013) and the adopted Supplementary Planning Document: Residential Design Guide (2010).
Reason : 2 - The proposed rear dormer, by reason of its excessive size and lack of visual containment within the rear roofslope, would fail to respect the scale and proportions of the existing property and would give rise to a bulky and dominant addition, to the detriment of the character and appearance of the existing dwellinghouse and the surrounding area, contrary to the high quality design aspirations of the National Planning Policy Framework (2021), policy D3 D (11) of London Plan (2021) Core policy CS1.B of The Harrow Core Strategy (2012), policy DM1 of the Harrow Development Management Policies Local Plan (2013) and the adopted Supplementary Planning Document Residential Design Guide (2010).
description: Alterations and extension to roof to form end gable; rear dormer; three rooflights in front roofslope; external alterations
